meanings.definition: Any of a group of steroid hormones produced by the adrenal cortex or synthesized
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that corticoids are important hormones produced by the adrenal glands.
meanings.sent2: Athletes should be aware of the effects of corticoids on their body's functions.
meanings.sent3: The corticoid walked into the party, feeling like the star of the endocrine system.
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like a corticoid, flooding through her system with power and vitality.
meanings.sent5: In the play, the actor portrayed the corticoid as the hero of the hormone world.

meanings.definition: A synthetic analog of a corticoid hormone, used as an anti-inflammatory or immunosuppressive agent
meanings.sent1: The medication contained a corticoid to reduce inflammation in the patient's joints.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often prescribe corticoids to manage allergic reactions effectively.
meanings.sent3: The corticoid in the pill jumped out, ready to fight the body's inflammatory response.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted like a corticoid, calming the heated argument with their soothing effect.
meanings.sent5: The corticoid medication worked like a superhero, fighting off the inflammation invaders.
